speaker: Alex
text: I attempted to fix the last-minute bugs, but I failed to spot a few critical issues.
ipa: aɪ əˈtɛmptɪd tə fɪks ðə ˈlæst ˈmɪnɪt bʌɡz | bət aɪ feɪld tə spɑt ə fju ˈkrɪtɪkəl ˈɪʃuz
stress: I ATTEMPTED to FIX the LAST-MINUTE BUGS | but I FAILED to SPOT a FEW CRITICAL ISSUES
linking:
"attempted to" → /əˈtɛmptɪd tə/ (d + t linking)
"failed to" → /feɪld tə/ (d + t linking)

speaker: Priya
text: Yeah, I noticed. Next time, we should prepare to test earlier instead of rushing.
ipa: jæ | aɪ ˈnoʊtɪst | nɛkst taɪm | wi ʃəd pɹɪˈpɛɹ tə tɛst ˈɜɹliɚ ɪnˈstɛd əv ˈɹʌʃɪŋ
stress: Yeah | I NOTICED | NEXT TIME | we SHOULD PREPARE to TEST EARLIER instead of RUSHING
linking:
"prepare to" → /pɹɪˈpɛɹ tə/ (r + t linking)
"test earlier" → /tɛst ˈɜɹliɚ/ (t + e linking)

speaker: Alex
text: I totally agree. Also, I ought to remind the team to submit their reports sooner.
ipa: aɪ ˈtoʊtəli əˈɡɹi | ˈɔlsoʊ | aɪ ɔt tə ɹɪˈmaɪnd ðə tim tə səbˈmɪt ðɛɹ ɹɪˈpɔɹts ˈsunɚ
stress: I TOTALLY AGREE | Also | I OUGHT to REMIND the TEAM to SUBMIT their REPORTS SOONER
linking:
"ought to" → /ɔt tə/ (t + t linking)
"remind the" → /ɹɪˈmaɪnd ðə/ (d + th linking)

speaker: Priya
text: Good idea. I insist on checking everyone's progress weekly from now on.
ipa: ɡʊd aɪˈdiə | aɪ ɪnˈsɪst ɑn ˈʧɛkɪŋ ˈɛvɚˌwʌnz ˈpɹɑɡɹɛs ˈwikli frəm naʊ ɑn
stress: Good IDEA | I INSIST on CHECKING EVERYONE'S PROGRESS WEEKLY from NOW ON
linking:
"insist on" → /ɪnˈsɪst ɑn/ (t + o linking)
"checking everyone's" → /ˈʧɛkɪŋ ˈɛvɚˌwʌnz/ (ng + e linking)

speaker: Alex
text: Maybe we should arrange to meet every Friday to stay on track.
ipa: ˈmeɪbi wi ʃəd əˈɹeɪnʤ tə mit ˈɛvɚi ˈfɹaɪdeɪ tə steɪ ɑn tɹæk
stress: Maybe we SHOULD ARRANGE to MEET EVERY FRIDAY to STAY on TRACK
linking:
"arrange to" → /əˈɹeɪnʤ tə/ (ʤ + t linking)
"meet every" → /mit ˈɛvɚi/ (t + e linking)

speaker: Priya
text: Sure! I don't mind staying a bit longer to review things properly.
ipa: ʃʊɹ | aɪ doʊnt maɪnd ˈsteɪɪŋ ə bɪt ˈlɔŋɡɚ tə ɹɪˈvju θɪŋz ˈpɹɑpɚli
stress: Sure | I DON'T MIND STAYING a BIT LONGER to REVIEW THINGS PROPERLY
linking:
"don't mind" → /doʊnt maɪnd/ (t + m linking)
"review things" → /ɹɪˈvju θɪŋz/ (w + th linking)

speaker: Alex
text: Honestly, I can't stand dealing with these last-minute emergencies.
ipa: ˈɑnəstli | aɪ kænt stænd ˈdiːlɪŋ wɪð ðiz ˈlæst ˈmɪnɪt ɪˈmɝʤənsiz
stress: Honestly | I CAN'T STAND DEALING with THESE LAST-MINUTE EMERGENCIES
linking:
"can't stand" → /kænt stænd/ (t + s linking)
"dealing with" → /ˈdiːlɪŋ wɪð/ (ng + w linking)

speaker: Priya
text: Same here. Sometimes, I even consider quitting when it gets too chaotic.
ipa: seɪm hɪɹ | ˈsəmˌtaɪmz | aɪ ˈivən kənˈsɪdɚ ˈkwɪtɪŋ wɛn ɪt ɡɛts tu keɪˈɑtɪk
stress: Same HERE | SOMETIMES | I EVEN CONSIDER QUITTING when it GETS TOO CHAOTIC
linking:
"consider quitting" → /kənˈsɪdɚ ˈkwɪtɪŋ/ (r + k linking)
"when it" → /wɛn ɪt/ (n + i linking)

speaker: Alex
text: No way! You seem to handle pressure way better than I do.
ipa: noʊ weɪ | ju sim tə ˈhændl ˈpɹɛʃɚ weɪ ˈbɛtɚ ðæn aɪ du
stress: No WAY | You SEEM to HANDLE PRESSURE way BETTER than I DO
linking:
"seem to" → /sim tə/ (m + t linking)
"handle pressure" → /ˈhændl ˈpɹɛʃɚ/ (l + p linking)

speaker: Priya
text: Thanks, but I just carry on pretending I’m calm most of the time.
ipa: θæŋks | bət aɪ ʤəst ˈkæɹi ɑn pɹɪˈtɛndɪŋ aɪm kɑm moʊst əv ðə taɪm
stress: Thanks | but I just CARRY ON PRETENDING I’m CALM MOST of the TIME
linking:
"carry on" → /ˈkæɹi ɑn/ (i + o linking)
"pretending I’m" → /pɹɪˈtɛndɪŋ aɪm/ (ng + aɪ linking)

speaker: Alex
text: Haha, well, at least we both deserve to relax a little after this mess!
ipa: ˈhɑˌhɑ | wɛl | æt list wi boʊθ dɪˈzɝv tə ɹɪˈlæks ə ˈlɪɾl ˈæftɚ ðɪs mɛs
stress: Haha | WELL | at LEAST we BOTH DESERVE to RELAX a LITTLE after this MESS
linking:
"deserve to" → /dɪˈzɝv tə/ (v + t linking)
"relax a" → /ɹɪˈlæks ə/ (s + a linking)

speaker: Priya
text: Agreed! Maybe after the next release, we should plan to take a few days off.
ipa: əˈɡɹid | ˈmeɪbi ˈæftɚ ðə nɛkst ɹɪˈlis | wi ʃəd plæn tə teɪk ə fju deɪz ɑf
stress: Agreed | Maybe AFTER the NEXT RELEASE | we SHOULD PLAN to TAKE a FEW DAYS OFF
linking:
"plan to" → /plæn tə/ (n + t linking)
"take a" → /teɪk ə/ (k + a linking)
